intro: Lastrea oligocarpa, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including humans. Lastrea oligocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
